title: Research Ethics (RCR) Simulation-Based Language Education for Expert Competency Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Research paper writing and data analysis experience, basic understanding of research processes, academic writing and critical reading skills
context.additional_context: In an interactive learning environment utilizing smartphone-based VR simulations, learners improve expressive skills and argumentative structures through peer feedback and strengthen academic reading and writing abilities through case analysis

learning_goals: Learners can identify three or more research ethics violations by analyzing cases of research misconduct and explain them using text-based evidence.

Learners can apply a four-step ethical decision-making process (problem recognition → principle review → alternative evaluation → decision implementation) to three research conflict scenarios (e.g., data manipulation, copyright violation, conflict of interest) in VR simulations with over 80% accuracy and write a checklist-based self-assessment report.
Learners can apply five core principles of research data management and publication ethics to real cases and write reports using academic expressions and argumentative structures.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
